text: One of the worst pho i ever eaten.. And its twice as expensive. Anyone wants pho, go six min to the one up the street. Cheaper and way more flavorful!
beefy beef broth with noodles at approx US$14. Too bad they removed my favourite cold noodle with beef. after a week of steaks and pizza, I just needed this.

I had the roasted duck with egg noodle soup, and it was really, really good. I was surprised. I thought it would be kind of mediocre because it's in the little food courtyard in the Rio, but it was very good.

While the noodles were tasty, having a cockroach climb on the wall next to where we were eating was disgusting. When I brought it to the attention of the cashier, i recieved , "oh really? i can try to find the chef" .... yea..we will NOT be coming back

Shocked the reviews are so low. Trip Advisor has it at a 4. Not that I have eaten Pho all over the world but I have to say this place was great. It is counter service but they were very friendly. Next time I am in Vegas I will be coming back.

Was pleasantly surprised with the food quality considering I'm vietnamese from San Diego. Price is doubled like everything else in vegas. Portion is huge. Was pretty good find. I would eat there again and trust the Asian ingredients are pretty authentic.

The value of this place is really good: you get nice food for a decent price. The char-grilled meat was really fantastic, I was really tempted to go back at the counter and ask for just a plate of that.
I tried this place in the Rio Casino and the Pho was delicious! I got beef pho and the bowl was huge! The broth had a very delicious taste to it! I would get it again!

This place is a complete embarrassment to Vietnamese cuisine. The food was disgusting and should not be eaten by anyone. I ordered a pho ga and it was the most disappointing Vietnamese food I have ever had. First off, they tried to use egg noodles in the pho, which is completely wrong. So we requested rice noodles (the correct noodles) instead. It was completely undercooked and had the consistency of rubber. The broth wasn't even chicken broth. Instead, it was broth used in wonton soup. The chicken was very bland with too much cartilage and tendon. This bowl of pho was so egregious and the portion size was incredibly small, considering it cost over $16. While I understand this is Las Vegas and everything will be overpriced, $16 bowl of pho at such low quality is ridiculous. It was also so poorly made that I was left with a stomach ache for hours, and I didn't even eat half of it. Save your money, disappointment, and stomachs by going elsewhere.

Faux pho. A good bowl of pho is all about the beef broth, which should be clear, complex and aromatic. This was fatty and one-dimensional, like a can of cheap chicken noodle soup. I've eaten pho in many places, and this was by far the worst.

Bun rieu-7/10 
Must say best one Ive had so far in Vegas! It's cheap and taste like home! Next time I come I shall try something else. Don't forget to use your rewards card for 1$ off. Or even better, check to see if it can be completely comp.

If you're heading to the Rio for pho, drive the extra minute to go to any other pho shop in Chinatown. The soup isn't hot, it's not good, the onions aren't fresh, and the meat is chewy. It's a shame that this place appears to be owned by Vietnamese people because it's by far the worst pho I've had (and that includes the instant variety). Whenever I eat pho, I drink ALL the soup...it's just too salty and lukewarm to do that here. Free fortune cookie though, yay, lol.
Avoid this place like the plague!!    They have 3 idiots running the kitchen and are turning out precooked meals 2 every 20 minutes. Been here 1 hour and still waiting for them to pour SOUP!!

All can say is..... $16.75 for a bowl of chicken pho and it's full of msg.  I understand it's inside a casino and you're gonna pay higher prices but at least try to make it worth the price tag. 

Crazy price mark up!!!!

Their boba was just powdered mix and we had to wait over a half hour for them. Not worth the price and the size of the drink was far too small to even be considered a little enjoyable. Their pho was just fine but it was the same problems as the boba. Had to wait too long because they didn't call our number out loud enough. Overall, I won't be coming back here again.

I was so excited to find a Pho place in Vegas. I ordered the Pho Ga (chicken noodle). The broth was good, the noodles were good. But I only found a couple of edible bites of chicken. The rest was covered in skin, cartilage and tendons. It was disgusting. I've tried MANY MANY Pho restaurants and I've never had one serve chicken as awful as this. Very disappointing.
Surprise!  The pho and duck noodles are good with generous portions of beef and duck, respectively.  Of course, it's vegas prices, but what can you do?

FALSE ADVERTISING!!!
 
Their website very clearly shows that they offer vegetable broth as an option with which to order some Pho, as well as tofu and vegetables as optional ingredients. But when we went down to their counter to ask an employee about it we were told that our only options would be beef or chicken. When we confronted him about what the website said, he just shook his head.

Are you fucking kidding me? If you don't have a product in stock, then DON'T ADVERTISE IT!!!

"Meh" at best. The broth was tasty, meat was scarce, and the cilantro was abundant. So I guess if you're looking for some good broth with cilantro, this is your place. 
Better off going a couple blocks down the street for some real pho. 
Seriously though - the cilantro overpowers. And I think it outweighed the chicken. 
Service was nice though. That's one of my two stars.

Super disappointing!! We ordered a bunch of food pho, egg rolls, Mongolian chicken, pad Thai and I will never ever eat here again. 
The pho was extremely salty not sure if it's msg in it or not we will find out in a few hours, the egg rolls are pictured the entire egg roll inside and out is over fried the heat is too high or they left it too long. After this even if the other dishes were spectacular they'd have little hope at this point. If you have to eat anything try the drunk donkey as its a better fare there. 
Junk. Sorry just junk.

We wanted something more than a deli after the awesome penn and teller show. So this was a nice surprise! They were very nice at the counter and we have never had pho before so don't know what to compare it to. We got a locals and a total rewards discount so saved like $8. Yes the meat/seafood was scarce but it was yummy for 11 pm. Would we go back? Probably not unless we were at Rio. But overall good for a late date night spot ;)

***Food options at Rio are very limited and there is not much open during the day; this Vietnamese order-at-the-counter spot (located in Rio's food court) is one of the few places open for lunch; the food here looks less greasy than the deli next door, but the food was below average (the grilled pork had an okay flavor and decent moisture, but it tasted like it was pre-cooked and then simply heated up; the egg rolls had an unappetizing color (no golden brown exterior; a bland, greasy and white deep fried shell)***

I imagine Rio offers free self parking like all the other major hotels and casinos on The Strip.

Expensive pho but also expensive real estate.

Pho was average at best. Good enough to fight the hangover but I won't be back. $15 pho is a bit excessive.

Not much to choose from at the RIO. If you are exhausted, tired and lazy. That's me. I am here.

Nothing like any restaurants in Chinatown here or LA, but late in the evening and in the casino, this is it.  Food was pretty average. Pork Chop was a little on the thick side, fish sauce was straight out of container but pretty bland. Pho was just okay. Pretty plain dish.   Wifey says it is meh. Double the price from outside restaurants. Oh well, we are in Vegas.

Only heard bad things about this place but was fighting a hangover and you know what that means....time to get my pho on. Ordered the number 3. The broth was flavorful but I still added a bit of hoisin sauce. Because its hoisin sauce duh. The meet was nice and tender with good flavor. The bowl was very filling. But it was a little pricy for pho but then again it is Vegas so whatevs. Solid choice to get rid of that headache.
Good food, but a bit pricey. I enjoyed the pho and the fried rolls, which were done just right.

Probably the worst Pho I've ever had. The broth was totally tasteless (think broth that comes out of a box). I was suspicious when they had a selection of Chinese, Thai and Japanese dishes as well, but based on other reviews, maybe those are better choices here.

Not good. Pricey and food was comparable to airline cuisine. Teryaki bowl should be pretty standard and hard to mess up. What i was given was a plate with a scoop of rice, 4 pieces of broccoli, and a piece of flavorless pale flat chicken that looked like it was warmed up in an airliner microwave. All of this for only $15! What a bargain.

I gotta admit that this place had pretty good tasting Vietnamese food - however I am just appalled at the prices for the food - honestly would not have tried this place if it wasn't for my picky 5 year old niece. She's the type that wouldn't eat anything and so when she said she wanted noodle soup - this was the closest place we could take her to because her parents was at the Celine Dion concert and we didn't have a car to take her anywhere else so we were stuck in RIo - which was where they were staying at. So therefore wouldn't have tried this place at all if it wasn't for her - but in the end she didn't even eat that much. 

Well anyways onto the food - we ordered a bowl of rare and well-done beef pho, a grilled chicken rice plate, a grilled pork rice plate and an order of spring roll, two hot tea and one coffee - all this for the outrageous price of $65!! This isn't a restaurant either - it's more like an express Vietnamese place located inside Rio and shares it's seating and tables with a pizza place and a taco place. The portions were okay - they weren't exceptionally huge for the price but they didn't skimp either - I guess it was just enough. Man I have never paid so much for Vietnamese food before - each plate was about 15 dollars - two spring rolls was 5 dollars and the two tea and one hot coffee was 15 dollars. The food like I said was pretty good tasting though but still pretty expensive right?

Well there wasn't really much service to speak of either - since we ordered and we picked it up ourselves. 

Overall this place is good for a quick meal and I guess if you don't mind paying a little more than usual for Vietnamese food then go right for it.

I love Vietnamese food but this is by far the worst....I ordered the pho soup with shrimp, there was no salt in my soup what so ever and had to pay $18. My soup ended up in the trash after I put so much salt in it but it didn't work. It was nasty
Ate here twice because I was staying at the rio and, well, I'm Vietnamese. Rice dishes are pretty good but stay away from everything else, including the namesake: pho.

Sadly, Pho Da Nang in the Rio Las Vegas has really taken a nosedive downhill in quality over the past year.  I ate there twice this past weekend (and ate there several times a year ago as well).  The Pho Ga (chicken pho) was borderline awful.  The quality of the meat, the chicken, was really bad.  I don't remember this being the case a year ago.  The chicken was rubbery, seemed not very fresh, and tasted terrible.  So I decided to give Pho Da Nang one more try another night and ordered the "Terriyaki Chicken Bowl", which, as it turns out isn't even a "bowl" at all.  It is a "plate" with a dumping of rice, a side of broccoli and the same terrible chicken chopped into strips.  The chicken was NOT fresh grilled.  It was frozen, sodium-infused, reheated breast meat complete with the fake grill marks you see at cheap fast food joints.  Very disappointing they would stoop to this poor quality level of chicken.  I couldn't even eat it all it as the chicken was such a sodium bomb, rubbery texture, and ridiculous fake "grill" marks.  I guess they tried to hide this by smothering it with way too much teriyaki sauce.  At least the rice and broccoli was decent.  Overall really disappointed and hope Pho Da Nang decides to ramp back up the quality level of their provisions to upscale restaurant grade.

The food is pretty tasty! I've had the spring rolls, pho, meat dishes - so I am hesitant to give this 3 stars, and our cashier is always nice. I have to say pricing for Vietnamese food was pretty high. Yeah, you can go a couple blocks outside of the Rio to have pretty much the same food, but it's also convenient. My hubby works at this casino, so we just go here on his break when I visit. I can't say anything bad about the food, and they do give you good portions. I would say if you don't eat as much, you could always share - especially the pho bowls.

KJ Kitchen at the Rio has some of the best Dim Sum in town - so you can imagine my disappointment when I discovered this particular asian eatery did not live up to the hype. I threw in an extra star because the staff was kind and attentive. 

Ordering is reminiscent of McDonald's where you tell them what you want and pay at the counter - then listen for your name and go pick up your food on a tray. I had combo pho with shrimp and rare steak. It wasn't bad but I also wouldn't return for it. I don't know if I can adequately describe the small difference between the taste of the pho here versus the taste at any pho place along Spring Mountain. The noodles, for one thing, are flat. I don't mind flat noodles but I'm hoping that detail can summarize the small noticeable differences between my go to soup spots and this.

If I was at the Rio and didn't want to drive to a different spot for my fix, I'd have Pho Da Nang again. The thai tea was strong but surprisingly good, so there is that. If you want pho and don't want to drive - give them a try! If you are craving thai tea, even better!

It was the most horrible pho that i've ever had. And the price just killed it. ---$15--- for a bowl of pho which i can have TWO somewhere else. 
I ordered pho tai sate. The broth was so dense and it wasn't hot enough to cook the rare beef. The noodle was so soft that i felt like eating baby food. I bet they bought cheap noodle or boiled it for very long time. 
Anyway, please do not be lazy to drive somewhere else to get pho.

Holy crap.  $16 for a bowl of pho dac biet.  The broth was way watered down and bland.  Hardly any meat at all and 2 tiny pathetic pieces of tendons.  My wife ordered a chicken lettuce wrap which ends up having Chinese sausages in it.  She does not eat pork.  

$2 for 4 cups of water.  Wtf....

Not impressed at all.  I know this is the Vegas strip and everything is expensive and all but come on...

Decent pho, not the best I've had, but certainly not the worst.  Serving sizes are quite large.  2 could share, with an appetizer.  It is cafeteria style, with tables that share an area with the adjacent Sports Deli.  Son had the Pad Thai which he said was good as well.  Prices at 2$$, if accurate, kind of expensive.  But, again,  large servings, and quite shareable.  Ok, came back to the Rio for a show in the evening.  Came back here for dinner.  They earned another star.  I had the duck plate.  Crispy duck served over pickled veg, served with bok choy and rice.  MAN, this was good.  $15, with the players card.  About $1 murder than the huge triple Decker club sammich sun has from next door restaurant.  Sorry, my duck was far superior!  Yum-my!

This place is freaking expensive. Holy shit. Over $16 for a bowl of pho. We were expecting something pho-king amazing if it's worth over double the typical pho. There's a lot of noodles, not so many pieces of meat, the broth was good...it's like your average pho so overall the food was fine, but not worth over $16. Our bill ended up being like $90 for 5 people, which I have never spent that much on pho. I get that it's Vegas but jeez...

I have had some OK experiences here in the past, this time convinced me to skip this place the next time I'm in town. Seemed like they used the cheapest beef that they could find. Chicken wing appetizer was better.

Pho size is small for $15. I ordered the pho combo. Broth was okay. Alot of noodles. Didn't even come with any tendons and variety of beef that a combo comes with. The meatball was weird. The only reason I ate here was because I stayed at Rio. Don't waste your time here for this mediocre pho spend $6 on a taxi to the pho place on spring mountain road. 8.99 over there.

The next day I was playing poker all day. I went ahead ordered the house fried rice which comes with shrimp duck chicken. Was pretty. Lots of shrimp.

It is not a good place for vietnamese Pho. Food is not good. I had bad experience with them. I went with my dad and they added tips without consent. When I signed the receipt I added another 15% tip on top of it, without noticing they already charge me for gratuity. Come on, tip should be added willingly not hiddenly charged. Be careful and check the receipt guys, this place is self-serve.

Out of all the places to grab food in rio I think this place serves amazing dishes. We ordered some egg rolls, Lomein with shrimp and a bowl of beef pho. Everything tasted so good and portion is huge. The prices are pretty much almost double what you paid compare to outside the casino but I think it's worth it with the fact it's located in a casino makes it convenient. The egg rolls were so good I like how they used rice paper wrap instead. Lomein flavor is on point I personally ask the cashier to add jalapeño :). The pho broth is amazing. I think that makes it a winner. Very friendly cashier. I would recommend this food outlet in Rio.

I had the Roast Duck with Egg Noodles for dinner and the Pork Chop for lunch. Both were delicious. There's a little bit of a wait and the dining area can get crowded, but it's tasty food at a reasonable price (for Vegas).

The dryness of Nevada mixed with fast food and smoky air makes me crave liquid broth so naturally pho is a good option to satisfy that craving. Located inside of Rio, it serves popular thai, chinese, and vietnamese dishes. I ordered a thai tea, pho with cooked meat, and charbroiled chicken with rice. Pricy but large portions. The broth of the pho is not strong enough but it was satisfactory. The charbroiled chicken was good with fish sauce! You can go to the counter for different asian sauces but damn, the spicy mustard is strong! Almost like eating yellow wasabi!! Overall, I would come here again!

Don't know what you all are talking about, but this restaurant is really good! Had the charbroiled beef and rice while the wifey had the special combo pho, also had the shrimp tempura and veggie wrap on the side and it was a great last dinner meal before heading back home to LA tomorrow morning. Complements to the chef and the very friendly crew especially the Filipina lady at the register. Will surely be back here when we return to Vegas.

The food is good and so is the portion. The amount of food you get is about  the same as at other Vietnamese restaurants, so no worries about the portion size. We ordered the Pho combo (#1 - was decent), Charbroiled pork chop with rice plate (#19 - was good), and Charbroiled chicken rice plate (#20 - was good). The rice dishes are tasty and authentic tasting. The  Pho was not bad at all. Yes, it's pricey but a.You are in Vegas, and b. it's conveniently located in the Rio Hotel for its guests.  Thanks Rio!

Came to Pho Da Nang after a couple of games of poker with some family. It is located in Rio Hotel & Casino and it seem decent from the outside. I wanted to try something new and I do not remember this being here since my last visit. I guess vietnamese food in Vegas and me do not mix well. 

Food Order with Price (rounded to the whole dollar)
#19: Charbroiled pork chop with rice plate $12 (Place two orders)
#15: Beef with Vermicelli $12 (Place two orders)
#22: Ice French Milk $5
#24: The Thai Ice Tea $4 
#9: Egg Rolls $7 
Grand Total: $64

Customer service here was horrible and results in the reason that this place only get two stars. A male working who was wearing a uniform that was for a referee at a soccer game took our order. While another female worker with glasses was busy taken another order on the phone who seem to be in Pho Da Nang uniform. The person in the referee uniform throwing all sorts of attitudes at us today. It seem he might have not had any luck at the tables. The waitress who was busy on the phone when we arrived to take our order gave us a apology earning one star back. 

The food it really standard for Vietnamese. The prices are a little hiked compared to the price in NYC but it a casino and Vegas (Hint: You if are a local you get a discount! ). I stayed away from the pho noodles because of the mix reviews from fellow yelpers. Probably the best thing is the egg rolls number 9. They are massive compared to the New York City version.

If you are looking for just plan old average vietnamese food with served with a side of FRESH ATTITUDE this is the place to be! Probably visit again but next time I will tell them to hold the attitude.
Everytime we visit Vegas, we eat at the Rio - just for this place! The pho, udon with tempura shrimp, lo mein, everything is delicious!

This restaurant was a bit pricey but hey it is vegas! They had many options from pho, to Thai noodles, Chinese low mein, Japanese udon noodles, chicken lettuce wraps and more. Very fast and quick place to grab a bite after a long day in the sun, gabbling, or before you head out to the club! 
I will be back if I stay at the Rio again :) It was the perfect place to go after dancing/performing all day at the Pure Aloha Festival with my LEIISA dance fam!

This place was amazing! It was a bit pricey for their noodle soup, but it was well worth it! The broth was on point, and they give you a very large bowl. I order the combination that came with rare steak, tendon, and tripe! It was such a great hangover cure....lol. I would have to think twice about coming here because of the price 15.13 for pho when I know I can get right down the street in spring mountain for half the price...

I'm not often compelled to expend the energy writing a review, good or bad - but this place is really lousy.  I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai - it came out as a giant plate of goopy noodles with chicken scraps - completely disgusting to look at and even worse to eat.
Pad Thai is good when the lime comes in to play. Pho is alright. Cashier is friendly and some tips help along the line (;

We ate here last night and it was really tasty. I had the won ton noodle soup. Very yummy. I do wish they offered half sizes though. I have a pretty hearty appetite as does my husband and neither of us could finish our food. I felt like it was a lot of wasted food and money. Next time we will share a bowl and it will be plenty.

I stayed at the Rio & was happy to see a Vietnamese restaurant right next to the registration desk. We've been there twice so far during our 6- night stay. We've tried the pork chop rice plate, beef rice plate, & rare beef pho. All dishes were great! The pork chops are my favorite. I want to go back tomorrow to try the chicken rice plate. I would definitely recommend this place. 

$11 per plate with Rewards card


Ample seating at the sports-theater next door

Thai place was like fast food pho. They call your number you go pick it up. We had orange chicken. It can with rice and cooked broccoli. It was good. Not the best orange chicken but could tell it was quality chicken used. 
Would eat there again.
Really enjoyed the pho, and the restaurant is conveniently located in the Rio. The variety of condiments really complemented the dish.

Just ate here at the Rio! We were excited to see a pho place. I ordered the beef pho and my friend got the combo pho. Both were tasty. Big bowl with lots of noodles and soup plus side of veggies. Perfect hangover cure food!!! 

Also they were super fast like 5 minutes!

The meat is seasoned so wonderfully, especially the beef in the #18! 

Kind of pricey considering the amount of food (ordered a rice plate- so scoop of rice and some meat), but of course it's Vegas and everything is more expensive! First time eating Vietnamese and it was a good introduction :)

Customer service was good- we didn't know what we were doing and when we ordered rice stick plates the hostess told us they were cold dishes, which we didn't want. She was able to recommend two other dishes similar to what we ordered originally but that were warm dishes served with rice.

While staying, my husband and I decided to use our housekeeping credit here. This is a very good place because your credit will go far. Don't forget your locals discount too!

Husband got the vegetable udon and asked for extra mushrooms. I got the roast duck platter. We got them both to go and both were very tasty. The vegetable udon did not skimp on mushroooms which I was happy to see. The broth was super delicious.

I'm a big boba fan and I also got the boba tea. They're all powders (not fresh fruit) so boo. I ordered the passion fruit boba tea (without any sugar - my usual MO). The tea wasn't bad but the tapioca was pretty underwhelming. Definitely not the worst boba I had but nothing to really write home about. I wouldn't necessarily get the boba again unless I was really craving it. With such good boba places around the area I wouldn't go here for it unless I had to.

Overall service was very good and the regular food was very tasty. For the price it was reasonable considering how much the other restaurants costs in the Rio.

Most expensive bowl of msg laced imitation pho I've ever tasted. The service and ambiance are good, but the pho, bun bo, mi quang are not so good. The broth has no flavor, and the noodles are very starchy. For $11-$13 a bowl, it'd be worth it to take a taxi to Pho So 1 in China Town for some real pho.

ate here during superbowl weekend. had chicken pho. it was tasteless and bland. not much chicken, a lot of noodles. was served with cilantro instead of thai basil. the bean sprouts were old and brownish. my friend had a meat dish with rice. he said it was OK. not a lot of meat. I was so disappointed cuz I'm crazy about pho. this was one of the worst I ever had. would never eat here again. I can make a better pho at home.

If I could give it a zero I would.  Spent $110  on 6 plates that tasted like soggy cardboard.  Also had to send a plate back as it was not fully cooked. Not even Thai tea was good 
Can I get a refund ?

This place deserves more than the average 3 stars. It's definitely underrated. From an express type restaurant, order at the counter and self serve beverage the food is the star. That is why I came back to this place when I'm in Vegas. It's located in the Rio Hotel. Just near the registration area. 

I ordered the Roast duck plate and I can't give enough race about how excellent the duck is. The skin is thin and crispy and the meat is juicy and fall off the bone. The dipping sauce added a nice sweet touch to a slight salty duck. 

I wish I had time to order more, till next time I'm in Vegas I'll be back to this spot to try something different.

Pho Da Nang is located inside the Rio. It's Vietnamese-based but they speak Chinese. Yeah. Iono. If you wanna speak Vietnamese, I don't think they'll understand :P

Walked in and looked at the prices. Sign up for the M rewards and save a $1. 

Service: They take a long time. And there was only 1 person in front of us. It took about 15 minutes for them to actually make the stuff and bring it out/call us. 

Seating area: They have plenty of seats, and it's "open" so you can inhale all the wonderful casino smells that surround it.

Food: It was alright. I got the shrimp rolls and it tasted alright. But at $8, it was so not worth it. 

The pho is $13-14 if I recall and they don't have that much ingredients in there. Idk why the prices are so high.

tl;dr- toodoo loo, don't return

Hostess was extremely helpful in choosing a dish. On her recommendation I ordered #15, which was beef and vermicelli noodles. Beef was really well seasoned and very tasty. The sweet and vinegar sauce that came with it was delicious. There was a salad of sorts under the cold noodles and it was nice to see some fresh veg in a Casino. I only gave it 3 stars because I have a favorite Pho place in Los Angeles which is much better but this was good and a refreshing change of pace from the usual inexpensive (relatively) Casino meal.

I don't like pho at all but I fell in LVE with this place! I ordered the  #10, chicken noodle soup, chicken rolls and my husband got some other soup.  

It tasted delicious, had a lot of chicken, good noodles, and came with all the needed ingredients to add to the soup. It wasn't too salty or too gingery. It was a huge portion also. Enough for two people.   

Eight rolls came in the order they were about two inches long but had such a great taste to them that I almost ordered more but I was too stuffed!!!!

Can't wait to go back.  I'm gonna try other places but I'm sure it won't match this place!!!!

Decent Vietnamese eatery inside the Rio casino. It's nice to get a touch of home food while on a mini vacation without having to actually leave the casino. Considering the fact that it is inside a casino, the prices were fair and servings were generous in my opinion. You walk up, order what your heart desires, obtain a buzzer, and when your food is ready the buzzer will let ya know to get your food. Pretty basic stuff! The food itself is satisfying enough to get your Vietnamese fill. We had their curry with chicken and chicken rice plate. I would recommend both! 

The one thing I found funny was the fact that my BF tried to order in Vietnamese and the cashier just gave him a blank stare until he translated his order into English lol #fail.
Fast food style, not impressed, Plastic silverware, Certainly not the best Pho that I have had

It's actually very tasty.  It's just that most people order the wrong items because it's confusing.  The bun rieu noodle salad with pork or beef with an egg roll is great.  It's number 14 or 15 and listed as rice stick. Most people don't realize that rice stick means noodle. The bun rieu is really awesome.  The pho and rolls are not bad.  Too bad the menu is confusing for most people.  I guess it's better to keep the lines low.  Also good is the dim sum place next door.

A good dinner option at the Rio.  I enjoyed my chicken noodle pho, and my friends enjoyed the bbq pork and pork bahn mi.  Dinner was reasonably priced too especially if you have a Rio card.  I was glad to find this place!

Not bad for an alternative to your run of the mill casino choices.  I think a decade ago you would have to go way off the Strip to get a simple meal like this.  Yes, it is expensive, but not really based on Las Vegas prices.  Taste wise, I thought the broth and ingredients in the Duck Egg Pho were pretty delicious.  I can usually taste MSG and other artificial flavors, but was fooled if its there. 

Not to mention, I needed this for my sore throat.  Service was good and the place was packed.

DT

We were staying at Rio and just wanted to try this Bc we wanted something good. Didn't want all American grill Bc of menu. We had the charbroiled pork chop with rice. It was so good.  Two pieces came with order. Of course the price is literally twice of what I would pay in LA but what do you expect being in Vegas. 
Good service.
Gross. Got the Pa Thai and it was awful. Fried rice was dry and no flavor. Don't waste your money it's over priced and not good at all.

This used to be a Chinese restaurant under the name Mahjong, it was really good, I don't know why they changed it to a pho place. The food was decent, but nothing that really stood out. I tried the boba and it starts to fall apart, no bueno. If you're starving and need a quick Asian fix, this will do, until you find something better in Chinatown.

Stopped here while waiting for a show at Rio. Each person in my small group chose a $12 bun (rice vermicelli) plate on the daily special board. Each was marginally qualified as bun. The portion of meat and bun was good enough. But the taste and additional ingredients were lacking.

I had two simple questions:

1. What do you put in your Spring Rolls?

2. What do you put in your Vegetable Rolls?

The response was snarky and condescending to both.  It was as though I should know what exactly was in each one. I do have a general sense of the difference between spring and vegetable rolls, but I wanted to make sure whatever I ate did not have any mushrooms.  The cashier indicated that both had mushrooms without even looking at me, and gave me the impression that I was wasting her time.  Our interaction made me feel like they didn't care about the customer, and that was reflected in the food as well.

So I ended up getting the spring rolls even though she said they had mushrooms in them.  I did not notice them at all, if there were even any in them.  They were the most unusually textured and wrapped spring rolls I had ever had.  It looked to have some type of extra crispy coating on the outside.  The taste was not terrible, but more on the bland side.  I also ordered Kung Pao Chicken as my main entrée.  It was pretty good, but hardly any meat.  It was about 90% vegetables, and I had to really dig to find the few pieces of chicken.

Pho Da Nang failed in terms of service and food.  There are so many other places in Vegas I would rather eat at, starting with the Sportsbook Deli next to it.

This was the only place near the strip that I knew with out a doubt I could get pho. I read menu after menu for 5 days looking for pho. The price was ok... for vegas. 2 bowls of chicken pho was just over $30. I didnt Care for the chicken itself. But it was basically as expected.  Clean atmosphere. Fast service. But it was served food court style. Pick up at the counter when it was done. The Rio is pretty far off the strip. So you have to taxi or catch the right bus unless you want to walk across the freeway.
Very friendly place to eat. Stephanie was very helpful assisting me. The food was very fresh and had great flavor.

Vietnamese noodle restaurant in the Rio.  Typical fast-casual restaurant with counter service.

Bottomline: Okay if you're staying at the Rio, given the limited options available, and don't feel like leaving the casino / hotel.

Service: Friendly, but somewhat slow.

Food:

1. Pho w/ Brisket, Tendon, and Tripe: Okay, nothing special but also not bad; broth was thin, but improved after adding sriracha sauce, hoisin sauce, and a splash of fish sauce; noodles were typical.

2. Duck and Wonton Soup: Okay, nothing special but also not bad; again, broth was thin; duck was all skin and bones, with very little meat; wontons were okay, but clearly were frozen beforehand.

We were in Rio to watch Eddie Griffin in the King's Room, and we thought of having dinner here before the show. Pho in Vegas? I was a bit skeptical since I got used to different pho places in the Bay Area. It was, of course, pricey. What else would you expect to have in Vegas? Their execution looked okay, but there's something missing from the whole bowl. I had to put a lot of stuff in it to get comfy eating it. It was a bit weird of how they took our order, got our money, gave us a number, found our own table, waited for our number to be called, and picked up our own food to bring it to our table. It felt stressful. The whole place was a big confusion to me, but we got our food, ate, and left. I started with three stars since the food was okay, although it was not on the level of my Bay Area experience. So, I finally decided that two stars feels right on the spot.

This place has changed their menu since last time. They now have a mixed Asian menu. There is so much to choose from! We ordered the egg rolls again and they are just as good as last time. We also tried Roast Duck Wonton Noodle Soup, Beef Chow Fun, Potstickers, Charbroiled Pork Chops and all were so delicious. This is the best food in the hotel! Cashiers were super nice too. We will be back for sure!

This place was my second favorite place to eat while staying at the Rio Hotel/Casino.  They had great service and pretty fast food.  It was all made fresh to order unlike most of the places here.  They also have a little board on the side with hand written specials.  Please note their specials change daily.  
if you aren't aware, Ph or pho is a Vietnamese noodle soup consisting of broth, linguine-shaped rice noodles called bánh ph, a few herbs, and meat, primarily served with either beef or chicken.  This restaurant also had a great spring roll option.  
The only down side about this place, would have to be the small bowls they use to go.  Other than that, all is good.  I recommend the Pad Thai spicy.

I was at Rio casino playing poker recently and happened to look across the hall and saw what I thought was a mirage. So I went closer and was surprised to find out a new Vietnamese restaurant in Vegas that no one has talked about yet . The name is called "Pho Da Nang". Their menu consists of many popular Vietnamese items, such as Pho, Bun Thit Nuong, rice dishes, etc... 

Two things that came to my mind when I was browsing through the menu. The first thing is I gotta try their Pho and hopefully (very hopefully) that Vegas finally has a good Pho joint. The second thing that came to my mind was "what the pho with the price".Holy macaroni, their Pho has to better be damn good if they want to charge $15 a bowl + tax. Almost eveything in their menu ranges from $13 to $15, Normally you would find this prices in the strip, but Rio is like 5 blocks away from Chinatown. 

Anyway, I ordered their Pho combo and it came out pretty quick. The bowl consists of noodle, rare steak, sliced beef shank (what the heck??? beef shank doesn't go with Pho, beef shank normally go with Bun Bo Hue), and soup. For those that are not familiar with Pho, the combination normally goes with thinly sliced rare round steak, cooked brisket, tripe, tendon. 

Did this bowl of Pho pass my taste test? NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO. The soup was bland and un-flavorful (is this a word?). I had to put a bunch of fish sauce and hoisin sauce to make it edible. The thinly sliced steak was tender, but the beef shank tasted fatty and not right for Pho. Overall, Pho is two stars.

Overall, they better cut down the price or improve the quality if they want to attract local customers. Since it's so close to Chinatown, I highly doubt they can rely on tourists as their main customers if they don't improve on their food.

This place sure hit the spot when I was hungry.  $12 (with the players card) for a rice plate seems a bit expensive though.  The wait was excruciating too.  We were the only ones ordering and the food took at least 15 minutes.   I went up at least 3 times to check on the food.  She kepy saying it was not ready yet.  I wonder what the chefs were doing in the back.  I would not come here again because I really dislike the Rio.  It is so far from everything, making one's choices very limited.

I'll give credit for being one of the cheapest food options inside the Rio. Tried the chicken pad Thai while my husband had the chicken lo mein. It was $14 a dish, but they serve huge portions. We wished we'd known that, so we could've split just one entree. Nonetheless, bigger portion doesn't mean better taste. Both dishes were simply okay, like I attempted making these dishes in my own home, not like I was at a legit eating establishment. The dishes tasted like some key ingredient was missing, but I couldn't identify what. Felt very gross after eating here, and again when reheating the leftovers the next day.

I was pleasantly surprised at how good my Ban mi pork sandwich was. Bread was light and crispy, pork was very flavorful. For 9 bucks it's a pretty big sandwich. Even my picky husband left his pizza and ate some sandwich . I'm curious to try another dish.

Prices and food available on the official casino website are a pitiful reflection of the actual prices/food and TR does not get you a discount. $3 for an egg roll? At least it's not a dinky one, but come on. FYI sushi at the front is half price 1hr before closing. I asked if it was made in house/fresh daily and was told yes, but I'm pretty skeptical.

Hmmmmmm how should I rate this restaurant.  If there is a minus zero I would have rate it. This place is so horrible.  What a disgrace to vietnamese. PHO is one of the  best in vietnamese food, how could you cook it so bland. No taste. it literally taste like just water. The Waiting is so long. Service sucks. Ordered to go and it has yet to be done. It's been 25 going on 30 minures. Wth!  Not even vietnamese running the place. Holy cow!!  Therefore do not go here to eat. No bueno hahahaha.

The pho is okay for a pho place in the casino and you don't want to drive and it opens late
service is bad, my old lady wanted pho but they kept messing up the order and people in front of her orders were being messed up, so she passed on it.
I ate pho here and it was okay.

Pho place right in the center of the Rio Casino.  I was pleasantly surprised by the presentation and taste of the pho.  I ordered the special pho with rare beef.  They give you a number and you pick up as it is ready.  I ate the whole thing.  Full for hours.  Definitely a good meal if you have a long day planned.  Try all the side sauces.  You never know which one will tickle you fancy.

line to the order counter...small discount for total rewards cardholders...fried eggs rolls, pho bowls and bun bo hue ordered...pay first and waiting for number on receipt to be called...lengthy wait of over fifteen minutes....self-serve sauce and pick up food back at the counter...find a table to eat....told the bun bo hue was good by the worker, but finding quite bland and meats chewy...noodles quite bloated and overcooked soft....same problem in pho...lacking much flavor and slight bitter taste...finding only the fried egg rolls being pretty good...

I tried this place twice, first time got the duck noodle soup - pictured here.   This is one of my favorite dishes and this place was decent compared to others.  The duck is very fatty but it usually is.  Good places make the duck crispy also but it was not here.  The broth, noodles, and overall flavor is a 3+.  I later tried the Pho Special.  It was very good with lots of meat and correct flavor.  I didn't experience the poor food that others mentioned.  I'd give it a 4-.  The minus because pieces of meat were very fatty and the pho was almost $17 - the most expense pho I've ever eaten!  I can get this dish for $7 in SoCal.  But this is Vegas so is expected.

Not sure how anyone could give this place anything above 3 stars, unless we were just so unlucky to come on a bad kitchen day. But coming from 3 authentic Vietnamese people, none of the food we ordered was good...even for just general food. My husband ordered a pho which was ridiculously bland and tasted nothing like the normal aromatic pho that any regular pho restaurant would give you. It honestly tasted like it was just made of chicken broth. The rice plates (grilled pork) that both my mom and I ordered came out cold and chewy. Not to mention this place is 3 times as expensive as a normal pho restaurant. I know its located inside of a casino, but spending nearly $20 for just a bowl of pho and a drink is pretty damn outrageous. Any other place you'd only spend about $5-$6 for a bowl of pho.

Horrible customer service! Stayed as a guest and me and my husband were sick. I called to place a take out order and room service and all they could say was " sorry, we don't do room service & we only do in person orders for take out and were really busy".  This was around 9:30 pm, not too late. Ummm.. So they're saying their too busy for me.  Wow! I have stayed at numerous hotels in Vegas from high end to average and never had this type of response from customer service / hostess from any Restraunt/hotel. The room service wasn't any better and gave the same response. As it is the prices are high  for restraunts at  an average hotel , so I would have a high expectation from customer service!!! I'll never eat or stay their again !

Decided to try this place at the Rio. Used my Rewards Points. 

This place is a counter next to the Sports Deli by the sports book.

Ordered the Chicken Lettuce Wraps. It was okay, nothing special, and a bit messy.  

I should of tried the Pho, but just wanted a small snack.  Prices are higher than a regular Vietnamese restaurant, but your paying the hotel price.

I would try this place again, but would get something different.

Don't waste your money and time eating here. We had a horrible experience. We asked the lady at the counter to suggest a good spicy dish and she recommended the Pad Thai with chicken. We also ordered the pot stickers as appetizers. The pot stickers were very average and the pad Thai was horribly sweet. There was peanut sauce and peanuts all over it and I don't really know how this was considered "spicy" on any level. Even good old sriracha couldn't rescue us this time. It was so sweet that we left the food as it was. Overall a terrible experience.

In the mood for Asian food while staying at Rio and decided to give this place a shot.  To my surprise, ITS GOOD Pho!  Compared to the other Vietnamese places in the San Gabriel Valley in CA, the pho here tastes authentic and fresh.  Broth was on lighter side and heaping hot, texture of noodles were soft and slippery, beef was sliced nice and thin, just the way I like it. Chef, manager, owner, employees here are all Asian Vietnamese.  If I was a local in Las Vegas, i'd definitely head here for pho.  Eggrolls were also good!

GET a total rewards card. It's free to sign up online. You save $1 on a lot of the meals. And you can pick up the card at a total rewards kiosk in one of the casino (eg. Rio). It's a pricey place to eat at, especially since the Canadian $ is at an all time low right now. But it's to be expected since it's right inside the hotel. With my discount, my beef noodle came to around $12.97 usd (tips not included). Anyways.... With what I paid today, I could have gotten two of the same thing in Vancouver. However, I just really wanted pho and it's oh so convenient. And it wasn't bad. The bean sprouts aren't as fresh as what we're used to back in Vancouver, but the beef and noodle were good...just like  the pros back at home :) but yeah.... Way too pricey!

I stayed at the Rio last Sunday night and also checked this place out for dinner. It's by the Registration desk, next to the Sports Betting area. It's more like a kitchen Pho place, you order on the list menu overhead. I had the Rare Beef style Pho, paid about $14.89 tip $2. It's actually not that bad, it seems like a lot of hotel guests would just eat here and then gamble. I forgot to ask them to put the bean sprouts inside the Broth lol, that's the way I like it. but yes, I Expect the place to be a bit pricey since it's in the Rio, a 4 stars hotel. :) I'd recommend for you to try this place out if you are ever at the Rio. :)
Really enjoyed this place. Got the pad thia and it was very good. Best food at the best price in the Rio.

Get a rewards card before you order and you can save $1 on each dish you order! I had seafood noodle soup and shrimp spring rolls. The dip was so yummy. I couldn't get enough of it. The noodle soup was delicious as well. Great dining experience.

Fast service! If you love fresh rice paper Spring Rolls - the Shrimp Spring Rolls with the Plum Sauce are delicious! Packed full of flavor - served cold - the plum sauce is thin and pairs perfectly - very refreshing!

Decent place. 

I liked the broth though I thought they were a bit parsimonious on meat. Especially since it's $13.99 for a bowl. 

It could use more work on bussing the tables. It was a bit messy in the seating area and I are before the lunch rush developed.
